060204-d-06-02-04-AGCR.Primary Accident Cause: Switch point gapped (between switch point and stock rail)
060204-d-06-02-04-AGCR.Accident Cause: Switch point gapped (between switch point and stock rail)
060204-d-06-02-04-AGCR.Narrative: AT OR AROUND 12:31 A.M. THE NIGHT CREW WAS PULLING 105 EMPTY CARS FROM TRACK #5 TO SPOT FOR LOADING.THE 105 CARS HAD BEEN PULLING INTO THAT TRACK EARLIER IN THE SHIFT, AND THERE HAD BEEN A LOT OF MOVEMENT IN AND OUT OF THE TRACK WITH THE SAME CARS  PRIOR TO 12:30 AM. ONLY ONE 300 HORSEPOWER LOCOMOTIVE WAS BEING USED TO PULL THE EMPTY CARS OUT.  AFTER THE ENGINEER PULLED OUT ABOUT 20 TO 25 LENGTHS AT NO MORE THAN 6 MPH, HE FELT A BIG JOLT FOLLOW BY ANOTHER.  THE TRAIN THEN CAME TO A STOP.  THE63RD CAR IN THE CONSIST HIT THE CROSSOVER SWITCH ON TRACK #5 AND CAUSED IT TO LINE ITSELF.  THE SWITCH PONT WAS GAPPED AND THE SWITCH WAS PUMPING UP AND DOWN WHEN THE CARS WENT OVER IT.  THE FIRST WHEEL FROM THE SECOND TRUCK SET ON CAR MP 641648 HIT THE GAP ON THE SWITCH-POINT AT THE EXACT MOMENT THAT THE SWITCH WAS PUMPING UP AND DOWN.  THIS CAUSED THE DERAILMENT  OF THE REAR TRUCK SET ON MP 641648.  THE FRONT TRUCK SET STAYED ON TRACK #5 WHILE THE REAR TRUCK SET TRAVELING INTO THE CROSSOVER TO#4 TRACK.  WHEN MP 541648 REACHED THE SECOND CROSSOVER SWITCH ON TRACK #4 IT RAN THROUGH THE SWITCHAND CAUSED THE FOLLOWING TWO CARS (MP 641465 & GVSR 90292) TO DERAIL.  AT THIS POINT THERE WERE 62CARS ON TRACK #5 AND THE REMAINING 43 CARS WERE IN THE CROSSOVER TO TRACK #4.  GVSR 90292 CONTINUEDTO MOVE ON TRACK #4 UNTIL IT HIT HZGX 3863 THAT WAS STATIONARY ON THAT TRACK.  THE MOMENTUM AND WEIGHT OF THE CARS UPON IMPACT CAUSED THE FOLLOWING THREE CARS (GVSR 90144, GVSR 90000, GVSR 90241) BEHI

THE TRACK FOLDED DOWN CAUSING THREE MORE CARS TO DERAIL.  THE EXCESSIVE PUMPING OF THE SWITCH CAUSED THE DERAILMENT.

302956-d-06-11-04-GTW.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to comply with restricted speed or its equivalent not in connection with a block or interloc

302956-d-06-11-04-GTW.Narrative: ROAD SWITCHER 119 ( RS-119) WAS ASSIGNED TO DELIVER 74 CARS TO THE NS AT NS OAKWOOD YARD IN MELVINDALE, MICHIGAN.  AT 1805 HOURS RS-119 RECEIVED PERMISSION FROM THE NS YARDMASTER TO PROCEED INTO THE YARD VIA THE ALLEN CROSS OVER.  THEY ENTERED THE YARD, PASSED OVER THE SWITCHING LEAD THEN CROSSED OVER THE EASTBOUND TO THE WESTBOUND TRACK.  JUST AS THE TWO ENGINES OF THE CONSIST STARTED ONTO THE WESTBOUND TRACK, THEIR MOVEMENT WAS SIDE-COLLIDED BY AN NS REMOTE CONTROL LOCOMOTIVE PULLING 29 CARS OPERATING ON THE SWITCHING LEAD.  COLLISION OCCURED AT THE 7TH & 8TH CARS BEHIND THE UNITS, BOTH LOADED FRAME CARS, FTTX 940636 AND FTTX 972914.

303176-d-06-14-04-GTW.Primary Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
303176-d-06-14-04-GTW.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
303176-d-06-14-04-GTW.Narrative: M383-31-13 WAS PROCEEDING SOUTHWARD ON CN MAIN 1 THROUGH THE INTERLOCKING AT VINEWOOD TO SHARED ASSETS WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  ENGINEER USED INDEPENDENT BRAKE TO CONTROL TRAIN SPEED.  SLACK RAN IN CAUSING EXCESSIVE BUFF FORCE WHICH CAUSED TTZX861837 TO DERAIL AT THE POINT OF FROG.  CONDUCTOR WALKED TRAIN AND REPORTED THE TRAILING END OF TTZX861837 DERAILED.  THE POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS AT MP 51.2 ON CN.  THE DERAILED CAR ENDED UP ON SHARED ASSETS ROLLING 2 LENGTHS OF RAIL AND DAMAGING A SWITCH MACHINE FOR A COMBINED COST OF $5,450.  CAUSE OF DERAILMENT WAS DETEMINED TO BE IMPROPERUSE OF THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE, RESULTING IN EXCESSIVE BUFF FORCE.  AFTER REVIEW IT WAS DECIDED TO UTILIZE CORRECTIVE COACHING RATHER THAN CONDUCT A FORMAL INVESTIGATON AND ASSESS DISCIPLINE.
